alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 07 at 8:39AM MDT until August 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO HOT, DRY, WINDY, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A very unusual period of critical fire weather is expected to continue through Tuesday evening as exceptionally dry westerly flow impacts northern New Mexico. Hot, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will occur again for several hours this afternoon and evening across the northern high terrain, surrounding highlands and upper Rio Grande Valley. The potential exists for similar conditions Tuesday afternoon and evening over the Northwest Plateau and North Central Mountains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zones 122), and the Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) today from 11 am to 8 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
